intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium kolicola, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium kolicola is known for its ability to colonize disturbed or barren areas, contributing to ecological succession in alpine environments.
